title: Oil prices surge, stocks mixed tracking Ukraine crisis
description: Brent North Sea crude was up 4 percent at $112.25 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate was also up 4 percent at $107.24 per barrel

title: SMC says buses to be allowed on Skyway again
description: Class 2 vehicles were earlier banned from using the Skyway due to the construction of the South Luzon Expressway (SLEX) elevated extension in

title: Big business groups, firms back return-to-office policy
description: Major business groups and companies backed the government’s move to get employees to return to their workplaces, even as BPOs appealed for an extension of work-from-home setups.

title: IKEA PH delivery partner Mober shifts to e-vehicles
description: Tech-logistics company Mober said it is investing in electric vehicles to cut fuel costs as prices of petroleum products spiked in the past weeks

title: Workers may need to waive OT pay to get 4-day compressed work week
description: Hours from the one work day removed will be transferred to the remaining days of the work week, and may have to be paid.

title: CebGo transfers to NAIA Terminal 4 beginning March 28:
description: Cebu Pacific said flights of its unit CebGo to and from Manila would transfer to the Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 4 (NAIA T4) beginning March 28.

title: Labor group asks for P430 wage hike in Central Visayas
description: A labor group on Monday filed a petition for a P430 increase in the daily minimum wage in Central Visayas.

title: Jollibee opens 150th store in Vietnam
description: Jollibee Foods Corp on Monday said it has opened its 150th store in Vietnam, which the company considers as one of its biggest markets outside the Philippines.

title: First Gen says recurring net income at P12.4 billion in 2021
description: First Gen Corp on Monday said its recurring net income attributable to equity holders reached P12.4 billion from the operations of its 3,495 MW renewable portfolio

title: Cebu Pacific revives P99 travel pass
description: Cebu Pacific on Monday said it would bring back its CEB Super Pass to tap the rising demand for flights as travel confidence builds up.

title: Manok, baboy nagmahal sa ilang pamilihan
description: Nagmahal ang presyo ng manok at baboy sa ilang palengke sa Metro Manila sa harap ng sunod-sunod na pagtaas ng presyo ng produktong petrolyo.

title: PCC gives Grab until April 22 to release refunds
description: The PCC said it found after review that only 24.1 percent of the total refund has been claimed from Grab by eligible passengers as of June 15, 2021.

title: Support female-owned businesses this Women’s Month
description: One of the best ways people can show their support is to put their money where their mouth is.

title: Vegetable truckers hike prices as fuel spikes bite
description: Vegetable truckers from Benguet have increased prices per kilo as the rising fuel prices cut into their earnings, a group said Monday.

title: 4 suspects nabbed for fake banknotes: BSP
description: The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas on Monday said 4 suspects were arrested in Pampanga for counterfeiting Philippine banknotes.

title: Fuel firms to cut prices; diesel down by P11.45
description: Oil firms will cut fuel prices for the first time in 2022 following price hikes which lasted for 11 weeks.

title: ALAMIN: Malaking bawas-presyo sa petrolyo sa Marso 22
description: Matapos ang 11 sunod-sunod na linggong oil price hike, magkakaroon ng malaking bawas sa presyo ng produktong petrolyo sa Martes (Marso 22), ang pinakaunang rollback ngayong 2022.

title: Saudi Aramco reports profit surge on day sites hit by Yemen rebels
description: Oil giant Saudi Aramco reported a 124 percent net profit surge for last year, hours after Yemeni rebels attacked its facilities causing a temporary drop in production.

title: Japan presses UAE to pump more oil as Ukraine war spikes prices
description: Japan urged the United Arab Emirates to pump more oil to calm markets rocked by Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the latest major consumer to lobby Gulf producers.

title: Ayuda not enough, suspend fuel taxes': Some VP bets
description: The P200 aid to poor families is not enough, and fuel excise taxes should be suspended, several Vice Presidential candidates said on Sunday.

title: SEC creates office to monitor lending firms
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is creating an office that would monitor lending companies as part of its crackdown against illegal and abusive lenders, the DOF said.

title: Cryptocurrencies' role in the Ukraine-Russia war
description: Cryptocurrencies have taken on an unprecedented role in the war in Ukraine, helping the government raise millions of dollars to fund its fight against Russia.

title: Presidential bets explain reservations on 4-day workweek
description: Philippine economic managers have proposed a 4-day work week and an extension of remote work set-ups, in a bid to cushion the impact of soaring pump prices on the commuting public.

title: 87k drivers get fuel subsidy amid oil price hikes
description: About 87,500 jeepney drivers in the entire country have received fuel subsidies worth P6,500 amid skyrocketing oil prices.

title: Bigtime rollback sa langis inaasahan sa Marso 22
description: Matapos ang mahigit dalawang buwan ng pagtaas sa presyo ng petrolyo, handa na ang mga kumpanya ng langis na bawiin ito sa susunod na linggo.
